title: Fear of Land Speculation on Maui Evokes a Bitter History of Exploitation
description: The history of Hawaii is one of outsiders taking land and destroying local culture.

title: Twitter’s Rival Threads Is Already Unraveling
description: The Twitter rival has struggled to retain the momentum of its historic start.

title: A Talisman Against the Taliban
description: For a network of volunteers still helping to evacuate Afghans, a small statue has become a unifying symbol of humor and hope.

title: Maui Depends on Tourists. After the Fires, It Also Wants Them to Stay Away
description: Officials are discouraging tourists from coming to Maui, where the tourism economy has already reshaped life for residents.

title: Why Recovery Efforts in Maui Are ‘Painstakingly Slow’
description: As Maui reels from the nation’s worst wildfires in more than a century, officials are struggling to identify and recover bodies.

title: Commercial Real Estate is in Trouble. Climate Change Is Part of the Problem
description: Commercial real estate faces increasing insurance costs. Climate change is part of the problem.

title: Iran Is About to Make Its Hijab Laws Even Stricter
description: Lawmakers are pursuing a 'Hijab and Chastity Bill' that would increase fines and jail-time for violating the country's modesty laws.

title: Is Anyone Having More Fun Running For President Than Vivek Ramaswamy?
description: “I think that he has been running the kind of campaign that Ron DeSantis should have run,” says a GOP pollster.

title: The Climate Crisis and Colonialism Destroyed My Maui Home. Where We Must Go From Here
description: "The wildfires of Maui, while devastating, have also ignited a spark in us," writes Kaniela Ing.

title: The Health Benefits of Music
description: Researchers are using music as a tool to achieve non-musical goals and therapeutic effects

title: Wildfires Will Put $11 Billion Worth of U.S. Property At Risk Every Year By 2050
description: Some 3.3 million U.S. households—and over $11 billion worth of property—will be at risk annually from wildfires by 2050.

title: Horatio Alger is a Hoax, But We Can Still Celebrate the American Dream
description: It's time to admit that the Horatio Alger myth is nothing more than that. The real American Dream is more complicated.

title: Invasive Plants Brought to Maui by Colonists Helped Fuel the Wildfires
description: Fast-growing and quick to burn, multiple species of non-native, invasive grasses contributed to the devastation in Maui.

title: Appeals Court Rules to Restrict Abortion Pill Access, Pending Supreme Court Approval
description: The appeals court ruling would end mail-order access to mifespristone, the most common form of abortion—pending a Supreme Court decision.

title: A Major Hollywood Diversity Report Shows Little Change—Except for One Promising Stat
description: The Annenberg Inclusion Initiative reports little change over 16 years onscreen, with the exception of one underrepresented group.

title: South Korea Is Prosecuting Its Citizens Who Went to Fight in Ukraine. Here’s Why
description: Volunteer fighters like ex-Navy SEAL and YouTuber Rhee Keun can cause a “headache” for South Korea’s government that has to deal with the political fallout.

title: Germany’s $3.5 Billion Israeli Air-Defense Deal Gets U.S. Backing
description: The deal is the biggest military export agreement in Israel’s history

title: Heavy Rain and Landslides Kill at Least 72 This Week in an Indian Himalayan State
description: Heavy monsoon triggered landslides and flash floods in India’s Himalayan region have killed at least 72 people, a government official said.

title: 3 Ways Teachers Can Instill Belonging in Students
description: Contrary to our cultural biases, the most important factor driving success in school and beyond isn’t IQ or grit, writes Geoffrey L. Cohen.

title: Jack Antonoff on Collaborating With Taylor Swift and Loving New Jersey
description: The singer-songwriter opens up about his secrets to collaboration, and why his music doesn't always line up with cultural trends.

title: It’s Time For GOP 2024 Candidates Not Named Trump to Rethink What They’re Doing
description: Most of the GOP field need to pick a strategy—focus on winning over Iowa conservatives or the nation—instead of trying to do both poorly.

title: Why So Few Foreign Tourists Are Visiting China Despite Lifted Pandemic Restrictions
description: A sense of distrust and caution developed over the pandemic as relations between China and other countries soured.

title: As the President Coughs, Are Indonesian Authorities Finally Taking Pollution Seriously?
description: The government had shown little urgency to address the air pollution problem until this week when authorities announced a spate of measures.

title: Raging Wildfires Trigger Mass Evacuation in Northern Canada
description: Canada is experiencing the worst wildfire season on record.
